alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Toombs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Toombs and east central Montgomery Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 239 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Ponderosa, or near Lyons, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lyons, Vidalia, Santa Claus, Alston, Center, Toombs Central, Ohoopee, New Branch, Ponderosa, South Thompson, Rock Springs, Johnson Corner and Cedar Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
